values.comments:
The first half of CIS 194 explores functional programming, using Haskell as a vehicle. The second half of the course consists of case studies in applications of Haskell. Potential case study topics include automated randomized testing, concurrency, parallelism, software transactional memory, and embedded real-time systems. 

Overall, students thoroughly enjoyed this class. They found it to be “a ton of fun intellectually” and “a much-appreciated departure” from other CIS classes. As one student put it, this was a “mind-expanding, well planned course.” Students credit Professor Yorgey for their enjoyment of the class. They called him “encouraging,” “engaging,” “a big asset,” and “a fantastic teacher.” According to many students, he was highly willing to help students and was easily accessible. 

Though this is not a required course, many students wished that it was and would highly encourage CIS majors to take it. 

This review is based on the 5 student comments that were submitted.
